forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy, with a low around 52. West southwest wind 3 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 21 mph.

forecast.name: Friday
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 66, with temperatures falling to around 64 in the afternoon. Southwest wind 3 to 18 mph.

weather_report:
As twilight descends upon Downtown San Francisco, a gentle calm blankets the city, the low around fifty-two inviting a light layer for warmth against the cooling air. The wisps of clouds allow sunlight to dance between the structures, hitting the buildings just right, illuminating the golden hues while painting the horizon with whispers of the fading sun. The west-southwest winds, playful and refreshing, curl around the corners of the streets, coaxing residents to venture out. The atmosphere holds a light haze, hinting at a marine layer lurking beyond the bridges, softly diffusing the light but leaving the city distinctly visible, with no heavy fog to cloak its charm tonight.

The forecast promises a brilliant sunny Friday to follow, though temperatures may dip slightly by afternoon. Given the delightful clarity and inviting evening, perhaps a stroll along the waterfront would be fitting. The calming sounds of waves juxtaposed with the city’s hum provide a backdrop for reflection or a casual meet-up. As for attire, layering is the sage advice — a light jacket to fend off the chill that seeps in after sundown, paired with comfortable shoes for exploring. Amidst this fine evening, one could savor the beauty of the city, wandering without a care, feeling the lively pulse of San Francisco’s heartbeat that only the mildest of winds can carry.
